snippet: Since protests began in Ukraine last December, 661 people have been reported missing, and the fates of 272 of them remained unknown late last week.
abstract: More than 250 Ukrainians remain missing since the beginning of protests in country, leaving loved ones to question whether they were victims of state repression or have simply returned to quiet lives; many fear the missing were seized by Berkut riot police, by pro-Russian provocateurs or by unofficial forces working to keep Pres Viktor F Yanukovych in power, citing reports from escaped abductees.
lead_paragraph: Since protests began in Ukraine last December, 661 people have been reported missing, and the fates of 272 of them remained unknown late last week.

headline.main: A Kiev Question: What Became of the Missing?
headline.print_headline: Kiev Question: What Became of the Missing?
